title.rendered: Israel Aid and Humanitarian Efforts in Gaza: Jan. 4, 2024

content.rendered:
Humanitarian Aid Updates for Gaza Strip

A total of 187 trucks carrying humanitarian aid, including food, water, medical supplies, and shelter equipment were inspected and transferred to the Gaza Strip yesterday (Jan. 4). 88 trucks inspected at Nitzana crossing and transferred to the Gaza Strip via the Rafah Crossing, and 97 trucks were inspected and transferred to Gaza via Kerem Shalom.

Cooking Gas and Field Hospitals

Yesterday (Jan. 4), 4 tankers of cooking gas designated for the operation of essential infrastructure in Gaza entered the Gaza Strip. Additional field hospitals are in the process, expected to be operational in the coming days. Additional equipment and personnel for field hospitals have entered the Gaza Strip.

Bakeries Resume Operations

10 bakeries in the Gaza Strip have resumed operations after the World Food Programme (WFP) has supplied flour, sugar, salt, and fuel as necessary. At the current capacity, these bakeries can bake 2 million pita breads a day. Equipment for 4 WFP warehouses has also entered the Gaza Strip, and these warehouses are expected to be set up in the coming days to enhance the logistical capacity of the organizations receiving humanitarian aid in the Gaza Strip.

Evacuation Corridor Update

As of yesterday (Jan. 4), the evacuation corridor on the Salah a-Din road is closed and has been rerouted to A-Rashid Road (Al-Bahr). The A-Rashid road (Al-Bahr) will be open for passage from northern to southern Gaza only, both for pedestrian and motorized traffic, from 09:00 to 16:00. This will also facilitate the movement of coordinated humanitarian aid trucks to northern Gaza.

Humanitarian Corridor on January 5

Today (Jan. 5), between 10:00 and 14:00, the IDF will pause operations in the Tal a-Sultan area in Rafah, southern Gaza, to enable the movement of humanitarian aid. The evacuation corridor on the Salah a-Din road has been rerouted and remains closed, emphasizing the importance of the A-Rashid Road for the ongoing humanitarian efforts.

This formatting improves readability and organizes the content into clear sections for a WordPress blog post.

excerpt.rendered: 187 trucks of humanitarian aid entered Gaza; roads adjusted.
